title: Mohammad Majloom (35) and others
sub_crime: Primarily theft. But also against cow slaughter.
victim_action: were legally walking with the cattle at night.
accused_names: Mithilesh Prasad Sahu, Pramod Kumar Sahu, Manoj Kumar Sahu, Manoj Sahu
accused_action: wanted to steal the victim's cows.
the_lynching: The villagers beat up the victims with sticks, strangled them and hanged their bodies on trees and finally hid their cows in the forest.

title: Zahid Ahmed Bhat (19) and others
victim_action: were driving a truck loaded with coal to Srinagar
victim_names: Zahid Ahmed Bhat (19) and Showkat Ahmed (35)
accused_action: had stopped traffic in view of the strike following recovery of three carcasses in the district.
the_lynching: A mob of 9 people threw a petrol bomb on Zahid's coal-laden truck. Zahid suffered 60% burn injuries and later succembed.

title: Rajiv Sahni (25)
victim_action: trying to escape following a failed attempt of vehicle theft
the_lynching: Sahni and Kevat were overpowered by the villagers and beaten. Sahni died.

title: Sandeep Kumar
victim_action: was chasing smugglers during a routine patrol in the area near the Indo-Bangla border
accused_action: attacked the security men with lathis.
the_lynching: Villagers lynched one of them. The other opened fire in self-defence and killed one villager Ismail Mia and injured nine other.

the_lynching: Mob lynched the 4 men

title: Unknown

accused_action: called them under a false pretext of enquiring about a theft and were taken to isolated spot

title: S K Maheshwari (69)

the_lynching: The workers beat the CEO to death and at least two members of the management were injured.

the_lynching: Pal was hit on the head by a blunt object, most likely a stone. The injury resulted in internal bleeding, causing his death.

accused_action: gathered and blocked the road by placing tractors and other vehicles
the_lynching: The robbers left their vehicle after they spotted the villagers and took shelter in cane fields. The villagers surrounded the fields, overpowered and lynched two of them while others managed to escape.

the_lynching: Several people, including policemen, were injured in a clash after local residents stopped a truck suspecting it was carrying beef. The police had to resort to firing in the air to control the agitated crowd.Police said some local residents spotted three trucks carrying meat were crossing the Palwal-Aligarh road. While two of the trucks managed to pass the area, the third was stopped.

title: Unknown

accused_names: Chainaram, Kamlesh, Vikram, Jaswant and 50 others

the_lynching: Around 50 cow vigilantes on Sunday attacked a truck from Tamil Nadu ferrying cows on suspicions of cattle smuggling. The accused tried to beat the officials. They also tried to set the truck on fire but police reached the spot and prevented them. Actions were also taken against seven policemen who did not take the matter seriously and reached late at the scene

title: Pawan Singh (35)
victim_action: rebuked people for jumping the queue at the station.
accused_action: brutally assaulted and stabbed a taxi driver.
the_lynching: A taxi driver was brutally assaulted and stabbed at a CNG station after he rebuked some people for jumping the queue at the station. The taxi driver, Pawan Singh, lost his arm after sustaining multiple fractures.

title: Vinod Kumar
victim_action: Unknown
accused_names: Bhagiwander sarpanch Charnjeet Kaur and her son Amarinder Singh Raju, Mandeep Kaur Brar,  and 10 others
the_lynching: The accused took away Vinod in a trolley and dumped him in Bhagiwander village common point after inflicting sharp-edged weapon injuries.

title: Samarendra Samanta
victim_action: Stopped and beat a railway hawker from selling near Malda town station.
accused_action: raid RPF camp office at the Malda station and beat a RPF constable.
the_lynching: After a RPF constable beat a railway hawker, a mob of around 300-400 hawkers surrounded the RPF camp office at the station. They catch hold of the constable and beat him to death.
which_law: For last four months under the Swachch Bharat initiative, no hawkers are being allowed to sell their products at the Malda Town station.

title: Mangesh Shantaram Patil
victim_action: Lodged a police complaint against the accused's misbehaviour during a panchayat meeting.
accused_action: beat the victim with iron rods.
the_lynching: A group of eight villagers allegedly attacked the Sarpanch with iron rods leading to his death.
which_law: This is a case of murder.

title: Rajender Bhatia (55)
victim_action: Had parked his car outside his groud-floor flat which allegedly blocked the way to the second floor.
accused_names: Kartik, Ashok Oberoi, Mohit Oberoi and Sonu
the_lynching: Kartik along with associates allegedly barge into Bhatia’s flat and scold him for not giving him a duplicate key to the terrace. They get into a fight over car parking. Kartik and associates beat Bhatia to death.
which_law: Section 304 (culpable homicide not amounting to murder)

title: Munne Bharti and family
victim_action: Was travelling to Delhi.
accused_action: surrounded a car and threathened to set the car on fire if people in the car don't chant "Jai Shri Ram".
the_lynching: After noticing long beard and muslim veil, 4-5 Bajrang Dal activists surround a car and threathen to set it on fire if people (Muslims) in the car don't chant "Jai Shri Ram".

title: Ravinder Kumar (31)
victim_action: Had asked two people not to urinate in public.
accused_action: a group of about 20 people used bricks wrapped in a towel as a weapon to kill the e-rickshaw driver.
the_lynching: Ravinder Kumar was beaten to death about seven hours after he asked two people not to urinate in public.
which_law: This is a case of murder.

title: Mohammad Ayub Pandit
victim_action: Was on duty outside the Jama Masjid mosque.
the_lynching: A DSP was on duty outside the mosque on 'Shab-e-qadr' when the mob attacked him. DSP opened fire, injuring 3 persons. The mob then went on a rampage, targeting empty security pickets in the area. DSP was stripped naked and stoned to death.

title: Zafar Khan
victim_action: Tried to stop Municipality employees from scaring women defecating in the open and taking their photographs.
the_lynching: Municipality employees beat a middle-aged man to death when he allegedly tries to stop them from scaring women defecating in the open and taking their photographs.

title: Unknown
victim_action: Related to a boy (Muslim boy who allgedly 'eve-teased' a Hindu girl)
the_lynching: A Muslim boy allegedly 'eve-teased' a Hindu girl. The girl's family reportedly attacked the boy's house.

title: Ashok Kumar (40), Ajay Mishra
victim_action: was involved in a dispute over the pradhan election.
accused_tag: members of the opposition in the area
accused_names: Updesh, Nirvesh, Sandesh, Harikesh — and three other unidentified youths
the_lynching: Village pradhan was shot dead by some men outside his house. Residents caught one of the assailants and lynched him to death. Police suspect the murder was a fallout of dispute over the pradhan election.

title: Prabha Mohan Rangpise (40)
victim_action: had a quarrel over a cat entering her neighbour’s house.
accused_names: Amol Sandipan Balgude (25), Ganesh, alias Bhaiya Shrimant Patil (24), Akash Rajesh Monde (22), Raju Nandakishor Salve (23)
the_lynching: The victim's cat entered the house of their neighbour Raju Salve. But Salve allegedly threw it outside his house. The victim went to question Raju about this and got into a fight. Raju accompanied with his friends beat the victim to death.
which_law: sections 302, 324, 323, 34 of the Indian Penal Code

title: Guru Prasad Mishra (58)
victim_action: used to move RTI applications on development works done by village head.
the_lynching: According to a complaint, Triloki along with his brothers and sons attacked the RTI activist's house and brutally assaulted him. The RTI Activist, Mishra, died while being taken to the hospital.

title: Ashok Kispotta
victim_action: was involved in a land dispute.
accused_names: Ratiram Raut (50), Sadhuram (50), Asharam (54), Subhash (59), Mahesh Ram (59), Abhiram (20), Ramniwas (32), Anil (25), Vinod (23), Pushpa (32), Gulapi(40), Sukhi (48) and Basanti Bai (40)
the_lynching: Members of Raut family attacked the farmer over an old land dispute. Farmer died on the spot.
which_law: section 302 (murder) of Indian Penal Code; sections 148 (rioting), 149, and 323 (voluntarily causing hurt) of the IPC
